enWisdom: Hope is treacherous
False aspiration is the trait of fools
Hopes are the delusions of the foolish
Aspirations are the wares of the unintelligent
Aspirations are incentives for men
Hopes never end
The sagacious person is one who shortens his hopes
There is no end to hope
Hope is an intimate companion

Wisdom: الْأَمَلُ سُلْطَانُ الشَّيَاطِينِ عَلَى قُلُوبِ الْغَافِلِينَ
enWisdom: Hope is the dominion of devils over hearts of the negligent

Wisdom: الْأَمَلُ كَالسَّرَابِ يَغُرُّ مَنْ رَآهُ وَيُخْلِفُ مَنْ رَجَاهُ
enWisdom: Hope is like a mirage, it deceives the one who sees it and disheartens the one who looks forward to it
Be cautious of dashed hopes and seized blessings

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالِاتِّكَالَ عَلَى الْمُنَى فَإِنَّهَا بَضَائِعُ النَّوْكَى
enWisdom: Be cautious not to depend on hopes, for they are the wares of the unintelligent

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالثِّقَةَ بِالْآمَالِ فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ شِيَمِ الْحَمْقَى
enWisdom: Beware of relying on [your] hopes, for this is the trait of fools
The farthest thing is hope
The most honourable wealth is abandoning [false] aspirations
The most beneficial cure is abandoning [false] aspirations
Those who have the longest hopes are the ones whose deeds are the worst

Wisdom: أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ أَمَلًا أَقَلُّهُمْ لِلْمَوْتِ ذِكْراً
enWisdom: Those who have the most [false] hopes are the ones who remember death the least

Wisdom: إِنَّ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ لَيُبْغِضُ الطَّوِيلَ الْأَمَلِ السَّيِّئَ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: Verily Allah, the Glorified, hates the one who has long hopes and performs evil actions
Many an aspiration may lie beneath death
You desire for the unachievable is [a sign of] ignorance
The worst poverty is [false] aspiration

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ الطَّوِيلُ الْأَمَلِ السَّيِّئُ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: The worst person is he who has lengthy aspirations and does evil deeds

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ آمِلٍ خَائِبٍ وَغَائِبٍ غَيْرِ آئِبٍ
enWisdom: Many [of those] who hope get disappointed, and many a traveller fails to return

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ مُؤَمِّلٍ مَا لَا يُدْرِكُهُ
enWisdom: Many a person hopes for what he never achieves

Wisdom: كَذَبَ مَنِ ادَّعَى الْإِيمَانَ وَهُوَ مَشْغُوفٌ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بِخُدَعِ الْأَمَانِيِّ وَزُورِ الْمَلَاهِي
enWisdom: He who claims to have faith yet is infatuated by misleading aspirations and false amusements of this world, has lied

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّكَلَ عَلَى الْأَمَانِيِّ مَاتَ دُونَ أَمَلِهِ
enWisdom: One who relies on his aspirations dies without [realizing] his hopes

Wisdom: مَنْ أَمَّلَ مَا لَا يُمْكِنُ طَالَ تَرَقُّبُهُ
enWisdom: One who hopes for that which is not possible, his anticipation becomes long
It is foolishness to depending on [one’s] hope
One who lengthens his aspirations is not intelligent

Wisdom: لَا يَطُولَنَّ عَلَيْكُمُ الْأَمَدُ وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُمُ الْأَمَلُ فَإِنَّ الْأَمَلَ لَيْسَ مِنَ الدِّينِ فِي شَيْ‏ءٍ
enWisdom: Do not consider your stay in this world to be long, and do not let your hopes deceive you, for indeed hopes are not part of religion in any way

Wisdom: لَا تَفِي الْأَمَانِيُّ لِمَنْ عَوَّلَ عَلَيْهَا
enWisdom: Aspirations are not loyal to those who rely on them
